categories.category_description: Single-node queries that summarize node counts and property distributions (e.g., follower_count of TikTokUser, age or smoking_frequency of Person) to profile populations and content at scale.

categories.category_name: Content exposure by theme and topic
categories.category_description: Queries linking videos to topics/tags (YouTube topics, TikTok hashtags, video_label_content) to measure how often youth are exposed to themes like unhealthy lifestyles, gaming, or fitness.
Questions about Influencer nodes and their accounts (TikTokUser, YouTubeChannel), their follower/video counts and cross-platform video overlap to assess reach among youth.
Two- and three-node queries that examine who Person nodes follow (Person->FOLLOWS->Influencer) and the local follower graph to identify community anchors and potential spreaders of content.

Queries that connect Person nodes to Area and Municipality (LIVES_IN_AREA / LIVES_IN_MUNICIPALITY / BELONGS_TO) to analyze how exposure and behaviors vary across neighborhoods and socioeconomic indicators.
Path-based queries that trace routes such as Influencer->HAS_ACCOUNT->TikTokUser->HAS_VIDEO->TikTokVideo->HAS_COMMENT->(Person) to map how specific content reaches young people.
Queries focusing on engagement metrics (like_count, view_count, comment_count, share_count) and comments (text, like_count) to measure interaction with potentially harmful or beneficial content.
Questions that explore how TikTokHashTag and YoutubeVideoTopic/Tag are used together across videos and users to detect clusters of content and diffusion patterns.

categories.category_name: Associations between online behavior and health outcomes
categories.category_description: Two/three-node and path queries linking Persons' survey attributes (e.g., smoking_frequency, energy_drink_days, has_mental_health_issues) with their follows/exposure to certain content to investigate correlations.

Queries combining demographic and area deprivation indicators with online exposure (e.g., persons in high social_benefits_percentage areas who follow unhealthy-lifestyle influencers) to find vulnerable groups.
Time-based queries using create_time/published_at to track emergence and decay of videos/tags and to relate temporal exposure windows to survey timing.

Queries that examine non-textual video attributes (stickers, music_id, video_duration, voice_to_text, thumbnails) to see whether certain production features correlate with higher engagement among youth.
Higher-order queries to extract subgraphs (e.g., influencer-centered ego networks or area-specific co-follow graphs) for community detection, sampling, and downstream social network analysis.
